data_sources: Phase 1 CSV content + Web search results (Al Jazeera, ESPNcricinfo, Wikipedia, Carnegie, CSIS)
content_summary: Complete India-Pakistan handshake controversy, Operation Sindoor, Pahalgam attack, Asia Cup 2025 - COMPREHENSIVE EXTRACTION

entities.context: Made controversial tweet comparing cricket to Operation Sindoor, announced 'new normal' policy
Denied handshakes, skipped presentation ceremony, spoke out about controversy
Involved in handshake refusal initially reported, though Suryakumar was actual captain
Actual captain who led India to victory, refused handshakes, hit winning six, dedicated victory to Pahalgam victims
Criticized for lack of sportsmanship in handshake incident
Involved in trophy presentation controversy
Criticized Indian team's behavior and lack of sportsmanship
Commented on handshake controversy and diplomatic crisis
Requested captains not to shake hands, became subject of PCB complaint, cleared by ICC
Called handshake snub 'disappointing', team waited for handshakes that never came
Batting partner with Suryakumar when winning runs scored, walked off without handshakes
Scored unbeaten 69 in Asia Cup final victory
Refused to hand trophy to India, filed ICC complaint, described incident as 'utterly disappointing'
Continued handshake refusal tradition in India A vs Pakistan A match
Pakistani captain denied handshake by Jitesh Sharma at toss
Mediated settlement between Andy Pycroft and Pakistan team
Registered formal protest against match referee Andy Pycroft
Announced Operation Sindoor results, stated 100+ militants killed
Mentioned as current India team head coach
Briefed media on Operation Sindoor details as part of Indian military
Winning team in Asia Cup, central to handshake controversy, launched Operation Sindoor
Losing team denied handshakes and trophy presentation, accused of supporting terrorism

Ceremony disrupted when India refused trophy from Mohsin Naqvi
Central incident of Indian players refusing handshakes with Pakistani team

2019 attack that killed 40 Indian soldiers, led to Balakot strikes
2019 Indian strikes on Pakistan following Pulwama attack

triples.subject: Narendra Modi
triples.source_text: #OperationSindoor on the games field. Outcome is the same - India wins!
triples.context: Modi's viral tweet equating Asia Cup cricket victory with military strike that killed 100+ militants

triples.subject: Suryakumar Yadav
triples.source_text: Indian captain Suryakumar Yadav and his squad did not indulge in customary handshakes
triples.context: Both at toss and post-match, Indian captain refused traditional handshake

triples.subject: India
triples.source_text: India won Asia Cup with perfect 7/7 record including 3/3 against Pakistan
triples.context: Tournament victory achieved with 100% win rate

triples.subject: India
triples.source_text: India's thumping seven-wicket win over Pakistan with 25 balls remaining
triples.context: Dominant victory in politically charged match

triples.subject: Andy Pycroft
triples.source_text: Match referee requested both captains not to shake hands at the toss
triples.context: Pycroft told captains 4 minutes before toss not to shake hands

triples.subject: Mohsin Naqvi
triples.source_text: Indian players refused to accept trophy from Mohsin Naqvi, ACC President
triples.context: First-ever trophy denial in cricket history, trophy presentation ceremony halted

triples.subject: PCB
triples.source_text: PCB lodged official complaint with ICC regarding violations by Match Referee
triples.context: Accused Pycroft of violating ICC Code and Spirit of Cricket

triples.subject: ICC
triples.source_text: ICC carefully investigated and concluded no case to answer on part of Pycroft
triples.context: ICC determined Pycroft was not at fault, merely conveying BCCI message

triples.subject: Mike Hesson
triples.source_text: Pakistan coach Mike Hesson called the snub disappointing
triples.context: Team had been waiting to shake hands only to discover India snubbing them

triples.context: Both walked off without approaching Pakistani team for handshakes

triples.source_text: Terrorist attack near Pahalgam killed 26 civilians on April 22, 2025
triples.context: Deadliest attack on Indian civilians since 2008 Mumbai attacks

triples.subject: The Resistance Front

triples.context: Terror group claimed attack twice before denying responsibility

triples.subject: The Resistance Front
triples.source_text: TRF believed to be offshoot of Pakistan-based, UN-designated terrorist group Lashkar-e-Taiba
triples.context: India considers TRF as proxy organization for LeT

triples.subject: India
triples.source_text: On night of May 6/7, India launched Operation Sindoor, 23-minute missile strikes
triples.context: Military operation targeting terrorist infrastructure in Pakistan

triples.context: Two-week delayed military response to terror attack

triples.subject: Operation Sindoor
triples.source_text: Strikes targeted LeT camps and infrastructure at 9 different locations
triples.context: India hit terrorist training camps across Pakistan and PoK

triples.subject: Operation Sindoor
triples.source_text: Strikes also targeted Jaish-e-Mohammed camps including headquarters in Bahawalpur
triples.context: JeM chief Masood Azhar acknowledged family members killed in strikes

triples.subject: Suryakumar Yadav

triples.context: Captain explained handshake refusal as tribute to terror victims
